comments.raw_text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.0; rv:2.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0.1
Build Identifier: Mozilla Firefox 4.0.1

The animated "loading" icon jerks endlessly and the "Waiting for yippy" mesage in the status line cycles endlessly 

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. visit http://search.yippy.com/ 
2.
3.

Actual Results:  
cycles endlessly 

Expected Results:  
show the page 

Happens under both xp and 2k
comments.author: sezor@fastmail.fm

comments.author: sezor@fastmail.fm
comments.text:
Created attachment 535942
No attachment

It would have to be an animated one, which is probably beyond me. 
The problem is not the appearance, it is that Firefox 4.0.1 is unable to access http://search.yippy.com/ 
I added the other details in case they help - to me they suggest that when it fails to access the site, it retries every second or so, without success.  
(The problem occurs with both Zone Alarm & Comodo firewalls, incidentally.)
comments.raw_text:
It would have to be an animated one, which is probably beyond me. 
The problem is not the appearance, it is that Firefox 4.0.1 is unable to access http://search.yippy.com/ 
I added the other details in case they help - to me they suggest that when it fails to access the site, it retries every second or so, without success.  
(The problem occurs with both Zone Alarm & Comodo firewalls, incidentally.)

(In reply to comment #6)
> (The problem occurs with both Zone Alarm & Comodo firewalls, incidentally.)

Hmm, please set Firefox' Executable and/or its Installation Directory to their Whitelist and retest. You can also try renaming "firefox.exe" to "something_else.exe" for testing Purpose.

Anyways, this smells INVALID.
comments.creator: xtc4uall@gmail.com

comments.raw_text:
IMHO, this bug is wrongly titled - it should be 
"Firefox 4.0.1 unable to access http://search.yippy.com/" 
(I'm adding this a bit late in the day, I know. )

Update 
In Firefox 5 and 4.0.1, accessing 
http://search.yippy.com/search?input-form=clusty-simple&v:sources=webplus&v:project=clusty&query=chasmaticchaos 
yields the message 
"Forbidden You don't have permission to access /search on this server." 
while Firefox 3.6.18 & IE 8 access it without problem.

comments.text:
Thanks for the reply. 
I don't understand what that implies.  
Output ?? 
What is renaming supposed to achieve (except breaking my shortcut) ?? 
If the Comodo firewall objects to a program, it prevents it accessing the net altogether - output nil.
comments.author: sezor@fastmail.fm

comments.creator: sezor@fastmail.fm
comments.text:
The yippy problem is still there in ff 8.  
Pasting the url 
  http://search.yippy.com/search?input-form=clusty-simple&v%3Asources=webplus&v%3Aproject=clusty&query=respective+owners 
into ff 8 (under xp) still gives the message 
  Forbidden
  You don't have permission to access /search on this server.
  Apache/2.2.14 (Ubuntu) Server at search.yippy.com Port 80
while pasting it into ff 3.6.24 (under 2k), it works perfectly, giving a normal search results page
comments.author: sezor@fastmail.fm
comments.raw_text:
The yippy problem is still there in ff 8.  
Pasting the url 
  http://search.yippy.com/search?input-form=clusty-simple&v%3Asources=webplus&v%3Aproject=clusty&query=respective+owners 
into ff 8 (under xp) still gives the message 
  Forbidden
  You don't have permission to access /search on this server.
  Apache/2.2.14 (Ubuntu) Server at search.yippy.com Port 80
while pasting it into ff 3.6.24 (under 2k), it works perfectly, giving a normal search results page

comments.text:
PS 
the symptom serving as the title of this bug no longer occurs.  
It's now simply one of access to a site.
